alert.note: Alert for Clay; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 2:40PM CDT until April 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND VERY DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 009 AND 021... The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CDT Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 009 and 021. * WIND...Northwest winds sustained between 15 and 25 MPH with gusts up to 30 MPH. * HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity is forecast to range from 10 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
